column1: #Text=And regarding her career choice , she said her grandmother was an artist and her " family was very supportive " .
#Text=Later , there was a session with Sony PIX , with Minions appearing on the stage .
#Text=Interview with English comic book writer Ryan O'Sullivan
#Text=Thank you for agreeing to the interview .
#Text=So Mr O'Sullian , could you tell us something about yourself ?
#Text=I am a comic book writer from the UK .

#Text=I have written books such as Void Trip for Image Comics , Fearscape for Vault Comics , as well as a lot of video game-based comics , like Dark Souls , The Evil Within , Warhammer 40,000 , Eisenhorn .
#Text=How old are you , and when did you start writing comics ?
#Text=I am in my 30s , and I started writing comics , ah , well I do n't know , I have been writing all my life , but I have done it professionally for , I 'll say , two years now .
#Text=So the first comic that I did was called Turncoat , and that was purely online .
#Text=So that everyday , we 'd put another page of the comic out .

#Text=And that 's how I got known because people go online , they 'd read the comic , and then after a certain amount of time , we 'd collect it all together in a big comic , and they say that the first time you do a comic , you should make it small , you do a few pages just to learn it .
#Text=But for mine , I did it for a hundred and sixty four pages And I 'm thrown in at the deep end , and somehow I managed to swim .
#Text=But it was , it was pretty stressful , but was very fun[ ? ] .
#Text=Well , so how many companies have you worked with ?
#Text=I would say around half a dozen , at a guess [ ... ]
#Text=Image Comics , I have worked with Vault Comics , I 've worked with T-Pub : that 's a small UK publisher .
#Text=And what 's interesting is with the video game comics , that means I 've worked with a lot of other companies as well , like video game companies , so , Bethesda , SEGA , Relic .
#Text=I feel I 'm missing people out now , just ' cause it 's quite a lot .
#Text=But yeah , it 's been a lot of people .

#Text=But I would say , of them all , if I could talk to fourteen-year-old Ryan , and tell him what his future would be like , the thing that might excite him the most is the fact that I wrote a comic for Warhammer and Games Workshop , because that 's what was my jam as a kid .
